actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure to provide certain sentencing requirements in any case in which a person commits a felony while admitted to bail.

summary.text: Amends the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure (Rule 32; sentence and judgment) to require the court, in any case in which a defendant is convicted of a felony while admitted to bail, to impose the sentence for such felony as consecutive to any previous sentence.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure to provide certain sentencing requirements in any case in which a person commits a felony while admitted to bail.
